item.title: Erin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I hope she'll be a fool -- that's the best thing a girl can be in this world, a beautiful little fool." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Erin add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "People generally see what they look for, and hear what they listen for." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Erin add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Erin add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm sick of not having the courage to be an absolute nobody." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Erin add a quote by J. D. Salinger
item.description: "Mothers are all slightly insane." -- J. D. Salinger

item.title: Erin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Now the standard cure for one who is sunk is to consider those in actual destitution or physical suffering—this is an all-weather beatitude for gloom in general and fairly salutary day-time advice for everyone. But at three o’clock in the morning, a forgotten package has the same tragic importance as a death sentence, and the cure doesn’t work—and in a real dark night of the soul it is always three o’clock in the morning, day after day." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Erin add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "First you take a drink, then the drink takes a drink, then the drink takes you." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Erin add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Love is the longing for the half of ourselves we have lost." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Erin add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "But when the strong were too weak to hurt the weak, the weak had to be strong enough to leave." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Erin add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "On the surface, an intelligible lie; underneath, the unintelligible truth." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Erin add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde
